DOC.HEAD: Holdout Sharpshooters Said to be Aiming for Revolutionary Leaders
Eds: SUBS final 2 grafs, `Brucan is...' with 2 grafs to change attribution from Tass to Le Monde.
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Holdout loyalist sharpshooters with infrared telescopic sights are trying to pick off Romania's revolutionary leaders, a member of the new leadership was quoted Friday as saying. Silviu Brucan of Romania's ruling National Salvation Front was quoted in the independent daily newspaper Le Monde as saying most members of the feared Securitate, or security police, had given themselves up. ``It's only a few fanatics with some telescopic sights who threaten us now,'' he was quoted as saying. ``They now have only one goal: try to decapitate the movement by assassinating us.'' In an office at the Romanian Foreign Ministry with the curtains drawn, Brucan said the security police were able to use their better equipment to devastating effect, even in total darkness, Le Monde reported. ``They have rifles with infrared scopes. I saw with my own eyes 12 soldiers killed in front of the Central Committee building, at night, with a bullet right in the middle of the forehead,'' he was quoted as saying. ``In those days, we only moved around in armored vehicles. And each time, our vehicle was hit by their gunfire. They knew we were inside. They were everywhere,'' he was quoted as saying. Brucan also defended the decision to try and quickly execute deposed Communist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, the newspaper said. ``If the Securitate had freed them, Romania would have seen a bloodbath, an atrocious internal war,'' he was quoted as saying. ``We had no choice.'' He said the military tribunal conducted the trial of the Ceausescus on Christmas Day, Monday morning, and executed them at midday. Brucan is the former Romanian ambassador to Washington who broke with Ceausescu.
